history.content:
It is true that schedule.berkeley.edu (and therefore also schedulebuilder) will no longer be live.  Schedule Builder will be replaced by Schedule Planner. Students will be able to look at the schedule of classes through calcentral once it is made public. A publicly viewable schedule is being worked on but probably won't be live until sometime in July.

(Note: The document you link to is not current.  You can tell because it lists telebears dates and telebears will not exist after summer 2016. )

Enrollment for F16 classes will still follow a phase 1 and phase 2 schedule similar to telebears although that may change in following semesters.

phase 1: April 18th - July 15th

phase 2: July 18th- August 15th
Unlike telebears, there will be no closing of the registration window. There is no end time. Students can register anytime after their appointment time until the closing of the entire phase. open 24 hours. Appointment times will all be staggered.

It is true that schedule.berkeley.edu (and therefore also schedulebuilder) will no longer be live.  Schedule Builder will be replaced by Schedule Planner. Students will be able to look at the schedule of classes through calcentral once it is made public. A publicly viewable schedule is being worked on but probably won't be live until sometime in July.

(Note: The document you link to is not current.  You can tell because it lists telebears dates and telebears will not exist after summer 2016. )

Enrollment for F16 classes will still follow a phase 1 and phase 2 schedule similar to telebears although that may change in following semesters.

phase 1: April 18th - July 15th

phase 2: July 18th- August 15th
Unlike telebears, there will be no closing of the registration window. There is no end time. Students can register anytime after their appointment time until the closing of the entire phase. open 24 hours. Appointment times will all be staggered.

Department staff does not currently have more information (like when the schedule will become viewable via calcentral) but is hoping to get more from campus soon.

children.subject: Is there any place that we can check the scheduled times for EECS courses for the Fall, or are we going to have to wait until the official schedule comes out?

I received an email from another department corroborating that the new schedule will be released 28 March.

Additionally, Telebears appointments are supposedly to be released 22 March.

I have heard the schedule will be released on March 28th. 

Keep in mind that you can always find the EECS courses at eecs.berkeley.edu, under Academics > Courses

Our students (LSCS and EECS) meet with a Faculty member before enrolling in courses, as opposed to a CS Staff Adviser. I will be sending out information about this process, and a link to register on March 25th, and March 29th.
So in terms of registering for classes do newly declared CS majors have to meet with a CS adviser to get an adviser code?
As Michael-David said, there will be a replacement program called "Schedule Planner", or you may choose to use an excel document, piece of paper, etc.
So the "Schedule Planner" program will be released with next semester's classes soon?
I believe so.  An email from campus should be sent to all students sometime this week explaining more of the timeline of these implementations.
If there won't be any schedulebuilder or schedule.berkeley.edu for this semester, how are we supposed to plan our classes?

history.content:
According to this:

http://registrar.berkeley.edu/DisplayMedia.aspx?ID=Calendar%20-%202016-2017.pdf

the schedule of classes was scheduled to be released today.

I know the SIS project for redoing Telebears/OSOC is cutting it real close (seriously 3 weeks before TeleBears is suppose to begin), but when can we expect the schedule to be released?

Also, there are rumors around that the SIS project is changing schedule.berkeley.edu completely and that they're getting rid of ScheduleBuilder? Can anybody confirm this?

How will this affect newly declared students in regards to registering for classes? Some upperclassmen have told me you need to meet with a CS advisor in order to get a registration code?
history.subject: Fall 2016 Schedule
